definition: to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Tibetan Buddhism Tangka art has a long history and superb techniques.
sentences.chinese: 藏傳佛教的唐卡藝術歷史悠久，技藝精湛。

sentences.english: Thangka handed down mostly works of Tibetan Buddhism and Bon.
sentences.chinese: 傳世唐卡大都是藏傳佛教和苯教作品。

sentences.english: Thangkas are usually rectangular in shape, and the square ones are reserved for mandalas.
sentences.chinese: 唐卡通常是長方形的，正方形的被留到壇城使用。

sentences.english: The thangka, or scroll painting, is a special art of Tibetan Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 唐卡，又稱卷軸畫，是藏傳佛教的一種特殊藝術。

sentences.english: Religious painting worshipped as icons are known as thanka painting.
sentences.chinese: 宗教畫，圖標爲唐卡繪畫稱爲崇拜。

sentences.english: Tangka is the distinguished painting art of Tibetan Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 唐卡是藏傳佛教中的獨有宗教繪畫藝術。

definition: butter sculpture (Tibetan art form using paint derived from milk products)
Buddhist image/statue of Buddha or Bodhisattva/CL:尊[zun1], 張|张[zhang1]
Tsongkhapa (1357-1419), Tibetan religious leader, founder of the Gelugpa school 格魯派|格鲁派[Ge2 lu3 pai4]
sutra written on leaves of pattra palm tree
Geju (Tibetan: transmit word of Buddha) sect of Tibetan Buddhist
Dunhuang caves in Gansu/refers to Mogao caves 莫高石窟[Mo4 gao1 shi2 ku1]
